poem:
**Political Autumn**

In Westminster's worn hallways,
ghosts of Boris and Liz linger,
while Keir stands statuesque,
his shadow long, but unremarkable.
A stable kingdom's silence,
whispers of power now hushed—
leafless branches sway gently,
reaching toward the muted skies,
envy emerging like frost
in this crisp autumn of order.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "EU leaders may envy Starmer’s stable majority – Brexit's part in it less so | Rafael Behr Two summers ago, when the Conservatives had just defenestrated Boris Johnson and were rallying around Liz Truss as his successor, there was little prospect of Britain reaching the autumn of 2024 as a beacon of political stability. Yet here we are. Or rather, there stands Keir Starmer, in command of a vast parliamentary majority, unthreatened by a debilitated". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
